title: FC 25 : 12 Best Teams To Manage In Career Mode
body_text:
With EA Sports FC25's official release date on the 27 of September 2024, the hype surrounding the improved state of Career Mode is rising. Offering a chance for players to take control of teams across the globe, the game-mode still stands as one of the most popular in the game. As a manager, players are able to implement tactics, promote youth development and build a footballing dynasty.
Whether fans want to embark on a road-to-glory adventure with a small club, or work to stay at the top with a dominant team, FC25 will give players an opportunity to immerse themselves in the running of a football club. With FC25 offering a world of choice when kick-starting a managerial career, it may be a daunting challenge to pick a club. Here's a list of the most fun clubs in the new FC25 game.
12 Tottenham Hotspur Has A Good Mix Of Athletes
Bring Trophies Back to the North London Club
With Tottenham Hotspur going through a transition period, the team is littered with a mix of young talent and experienced players. The team haven't won a major trophy since their league cup in 2008, giving a new manager a chance to change the fortunes of the London-based club, all whilst performing in a new world-class stadium.
10 Best Mid-Fielders In EA Sports FC 25
Some of the best athletes in EA Sports FC 25 are Mid-Fielders, who dictate your team's offense to score goals by creatively beating out opponents.
The squad is a far from finished product, but with players like Archie Gray and Lucas Burgvall having a potential of 87, the club has solid foundations for the future. Given valuable resources by the board, players will be able to put their stamp on Spurs' daring philosophy and challenge on all four trophy fronts from the very first season.
11 Wrexham A.F.C Has Gotten A Lot Of Media Attention
A Hollywood Road to Glory
Wrexham have received plenty of media attention since their takeover by Hollywood stars Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney in 2021. Back-to-back promotions have brought the Welsh side to the third tier of English football, making their feel-good story one to be remembered - but an FC25 manager might be able to take them further. The thrill of taking this team, despite having a lower transfer budget, up the ranks of the footballing pyramid will be a rewarding feat for players.
Having cult heroes in the squad, like Paul Mullin, will give players the joy of tearing up league two, and fighting for a third promotion. The team has quickly become people's second favorite team, and they will be a joy to take-over in the new FC game.
10 Como 1907 Has Several Legends
Italy's Rising Stars
Having legends of the game like Raphaël Varane and Pepe Reina in their ranks, Como 1907 can be an exciting team to take control of in manager career. The team have been freshly promoted to the Italian first division, giving players a chance to battle at the top. Whether playing as current manager Cesc Fàbregas, or creating a boss, Como may have the story that fans will want to pen.
Their transfer budget is small, but that gives players a good opportunity to search for hidden gems or use the revamped youth academy system to find the newest Italian wunderkind. One of Como's most recent transfers was Nico Paz, an Argentinian central midfielder with high passing and dribbling stats for the 20-year-old - maybe he will be the future captain.
9 Fenerbahce SK Trades Superstar Risks For Complete Synergy
Claim Victory Through Hard Work And Optimized Play
One of the most storied Turkish clubs you can manage is Fenerbahce SK, an organization that has a shocking amount of above-average players. Although they don't have a top-50 superstar on their roster, all of Fenerbahce's players are excellent to invest in throughout Career Mode. For example, Youssef En-Nesyri is as dominant of a Striker as you could have, with very strong dribbling and passing abilities to create a strong sense of unity on a team.
Some other stand-out players in the Fenerbahce SK club are the Left Midfielder Dušan Tadić and Edin Džeko, another Striker. Both of these players have very strong offensive skills, with great dribbling and passing scores that outpace even top teams in other leagues.
This team is great for those who don't want to be carried by one or two athletes who have extraordinary talent. The long-time connections between players in this club makes them powerful when optimized with pinpoint passing faster than enemy teams can react. With Jose Mourinho, one of the most famous coaches in any league, at the helm, you may be able to overcome a 10 year drought and help Fenerbahce reclaim their league title.
8 Ajax Are An Iconic Team
A Fifth Champions League Awaits in Amsterdam
Ajax are a sleeping giant in European football, with an iconic club badge and kits, though the Dutch club had a difficult season last year, winning 0 trophies. The club has a rich history and an established footballing culture, but they still yearn for their fifth Champions League trophy, which their last was in 1995.
A club of this size and stature should be at the top, and the opportunity to take them there will be a roller-coaster story. Players like Kenneth Taylor and Jorrel Hato willl give an exciting core to the team, to help them flourish into a title-winning team once again. Clever transfers and investing in the clubs' renowned youth academy will be necessary to take Ajax to compete in the Eredivisie and Europe, making this career choice a fun one.
7 Ipswich Town, Newcomers With Talent
A Relegation Battle
Ipswich Town are newcomers to the Premier League, giving players a chance to experience the fight to avoid relegation. With talents like the Jamaican winger Omari Hutchinson and center-back Jacob Greaves, Ipswich will have a young pool of players to play around with and shape a managerial style. The Tractor Boys are well positioned to build on their promotion momentum and further the story of Ed Sheeran's favorite team.
Starting a career with Ipswich will give players an opportunity to avoid the ease of starting from the top, whilst already having strength and quality to build on. This career mode will be filled with the ups and downs of English football.
6 Real Madrid Excels In Career Mode
European Domination: The Pinnacle of Football
Taking on a team like Real Madrid in Career mode can be an extremely exciting avenue to take, offering an abundance of resources. The Spanish giants compete on all fronts with some of the best talent in the footballing world, including the likes of Kylian Mbappé, who will be relying on a manager to guide him to a Ballon d'Or win. With the spine of the team being young and a massive transfer budget, players will have freedom to shape the team at the heights of football- a fan's dream.
The Real Madrid board will look to players to keep to their high expectations, expecting nothing less than to maintain success, adding a sense of jeopardy to a save. Take Los Blancos to unmatched success and enjoy the rush of winning it all in FC 25.
5 Paris FC Is A Great Team To Manage
Underdogs in Paris
Paris FC have never quite matched their larger, richer neighbors in the capital of France, but managerial talents might change that. The underdogs will serve as a blank canvas to imprint expertise in youth development and scouting in France. With the ultimate goal to leapfrog their bitter rivals PSG, the player that takes on this challenge will have to undergo a serious transformation at the club.
With a small transfer budget, players will have to navigate the transfer market with skill, looking for cheap hidden gems and fresh homegrown talent. Though Paris FC hold a talent in Maxime Lopez, who may stick around to get to the top of League 1. Success at the club is long overdue.
4 Olympique Lyonnais Has Underrated Talent Ready To Play
Utilize Overlooked Talent To Dominate Matches
At first glance, Olympique Lyonnais doesn't seem like an incredibly strong team to manage based off their stats alone. However, the further you look into the roster of this team, the more surprisingly ultra-star talent you'll find on its roster. Another French team, this club just needs a guiding hand of good management to get back on top of its competition.
One of the challenges surrounding Olympique Lyonnais is that it starts off bankrupt and in plenty of debt. Working your way up through price limitations can lead to a unique experience not found in many other organizations.
Lyon has one of the higher-rated Forwards in Ligue 1 through Alexandre Lacazette, alongside some talented Midfielders through Wilfried Zaha and Nemanja Matić. The financial backing of this club is much larger than some other organizations, giving you plenty of freedom to reorganize it to your liking. The diverse and versatile nature of this club was strong in the past, so you'll have all the tools you need to help this club get back to its former glory.
3 Bromley FC Is New To FC 25
New Boys on the Block
Bromley FC, a brand-new team on FC25, achieved promotion from non-league football last year. At the very bottom of the English footballing pyramid, Bromley FC will be a patience-demanding and long-serving road-to-glory style save for any player willing to take on the challenge.
The reward for taking charge of the ravens is a feel-good story of promotion success and eventually a European challenge - all built from the ground up. Players like Cameron Congreve will help completely transform the structure of the squad. Whatever a player chooses to do, Bromley FC offer an exciting chance to experience every level of football the game has to offer.
